notes: irregular verb; past participle corso; may take avere or essere
past participle feminine singular used with essere for motion

example_sentence_english: I was running often as a boy.
You used to run with me as a child.

translation_english: he was running/she was running/you (formal) were running

example_sentence_english: You were running on the track.
They were running in the morning.

notes: usually with auxiliary avere; sometimes essere with motion sense
example_sentence_english: I have run for two kilometers.

notes: usually with auxiliary avere; sometimes essere with motion sense

translation_english: he has run/she has run/you (formal) have run
notes: usually with auxiliary avere; also used as formal Lei; sometimes essere with motion sense
usually with auxiliary avere; sometimes essere with motion sense
usually with auxiliary avere; sometimes essere with motion sense
example_sentence_english: You have run at the park.

notes: usually with auxiliary avere; sometimes essere with motion sense
